conclusion: To determine if the distance fallen is greater or less than 100 meters, analyze the area under the velocity-time curve.
Velocity increases from 0 m/s at t = 0 s to approximately 20 m/s at t = 10 s.
Find the area under the curve between t = 0 s and t = 10 s.
Compare the actual area under the curve with the area of a simpler shape.
Approximate the curve as a straight line forming a right triangle from (0,0) to (10, 20).
Calculate the area of the triangle: base = 10 seconds, height = 20 m/s, area = 100 meters.
The actual curve is above the straight line for most of the interval from 0 to 10 seconds.
The area under the actual curve is greater than the area of the triangle.
The distance fallen during the 0 to 10 seconds interval is greater than 100 meters.
